title: ISO - Straws get a sip of standardization
body: Plastic straws have to show their resistance to hot and cold temperatures and bend without rupture. ISO 18188 was developed by ISO technical committee ISO/TC 61, Plastics, Subcommittee SC 11, Products, whose secretariat is held by JISC, the ISO member for Japan. ISO 18188:2016 is available from your national ISO member or through the ISO Store.
readable_content:
- The text is sourced from a website named ISO.org and discusses the standardization of plastic straws, specifically ISO 18188:2016, "Specification of polypropylene drinking straws".
- The standard provides general requirements for dimensions and performance properties of plastic straws to help manufacturers produce consistent, quality products.
- It covers various shapes of straws and specifies that the plastic must conform to food contact requirements and demonstrate resistance to hot and cold temperatures.

ISO.org (2023-12-08): The website provides detailed information about the standard ISO 18188:2016 and its impact on the production of plastic drinking straws.
summary:
The website provides detailed information about the standard ISO 18188:2016 and its impact on the production of plastic drinking straws. It emphasizes the importance of consistent quality and performance in plastic straw production, highlighting the specific requirements for dimensions and material properties. Overall, the tone is informative and focused on industry standards for plastic straw manufacturing. 

Sentiment: 0.6
